definition: deference is no substitute for obedience (idiom)/(said to accept sb's request, invitation etc)
pinyin: gong1 jing4 bu4 ru2 cong2 ming4

sentences.english: It strikes a tone of irreverence and sarcasm that teenagers often appreciate.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們都喜歡廣告裏面那種不甚恭敬和諷刺的基調。

sentences.english: Is still quite respectful apt daddy mom opinion?
sentences.chinese: 對爹爹孃親態度還很恭敬？

sentences.english: When your parents need to instruct you, respectfully do as you're told.
sentences.chinese: 父母教導我們時，必須恭敬地聽從。

sentences.english: The fangs of surface humble, but the dog, full of greed narrow-minded.
sentences.chinese: 表面謙卑恭敬的大牙狗，實則心胸狹窄，充滿貪慾。

sentences.english: Berg was sitting beside the countess, trying with filial respectfulness to reassure her.
sentences.chinese: 貝格坐在伯爵夫人身旁，愉快地恭敬地安慰着岳母。

sentences.english: Of course I would go, I replied respectfully.
sentences.chinese: 我當然肯去，我恭敬地回稟師父。

sentences.english: He was respectful before his betters.
sentences.chinese: 他在長者之前很是恭敬。

sentences.english: Then he returned to the Blessed One, respectfully greeted him, and sat down at one side.
sentences.chinese: 接着他回到了聖尊，恭敬的祝福他，並且坐在一邊。

sentences.english: Then Yangzi's attitude is fairly reverent .
sentences.chinese: 這時的陽子其態度是挺恭敬的。

sentences.english: "Your Imperial Highness, " he said with a bow.
The footman bowed the guests out.
sentences.chinese: 男僕恭恭敬敬地送走了客人。

sentences.english: He was bowed into a taxi.
sentences.chinese: 他被恭敬地接進了出租汽車。

sentences.english: If that is the case, the Christian will respectfully refuse to join in these ceremonies.
sentences.chinese: 如果是這樣，他就要恭敬地拒絕參與這些儀式。

sentences.english: The old princess rose respectfully and curtsied at his entrance.
sentences.chinese: 老公爵夫人恭敬地起身行屈膝禮。

sentences.english: For instance:The boy was standing hat in hand before his teacher.
sentences.chinese: 那個男孩恭恭敬敬地站在老師面前。

sentences.english: Reverend sir, forgive this pair of sinners.
sentences.chinese: 恭敬的尊長，寬恕這一對犯人吧。

definition: variant of 畢恭畢敬|毕恭毕敬[bi4 gong1 bi4 jing4]
to half rise out of one's chair (a polite gesture)
to return a politeness/to present a gift in return
to nod one's head and bow (idiom); bowing and scraping/unctuous fawning
to cup one fist in the other hand (as a sign of respect)
to pay a formal visit/to call to pay respects/to meet one's senior or superior
